alert.note: Alert for Cascade (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:31AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cascade County through 115 AM MDT... At 1231 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Fort Shaw, or 10 miles north of Cascade, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Malmstrom Afb, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Ulm, Sand Coulee and Simms. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 260 and 293. Highway 200 between mile markers 129 and 139. Highway 87 between mile markers 4 and 8. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 10, and between mile markers 87 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
